intro: Tovomitopsis glauca, commonly known as the blue-green mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically a bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are usually dark purple or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Tovomitopsis glauca is native to regions in South America and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
